title: biocEDAM: ontology for a genomic data science ecosystem
text: biocViews package collects organizes terms tagging resources Bioconductor ecosystem genomic data science. November 2023 497 terms defining classes resources project. Example terms “Organism”, “BiologicalQuestion”, “Sequencing”, “MicroarrayData”. Contributors core members assign tags vocabulary software packages, data resources, workflows managed distributed project. BiocPkgTools package managing functions interrogate aspects ecosystem. obtain table software packages examine views:
code: library(BiocPkgTools) bl = biocPkgList(repo="BioCsoft") library(dplyr) s1 = bl |> select(Package, biocViews) s1$tags = sapply(s1$biocViews, paste, collapse=":") s1 = s1 |> select(Package, tags) set.seed(1234) s1[sample(seq_len(nrow(s1)), 10),] ## # A tibble: 10 × 2 ##    Package        tags                                                           ##    <chr>          <chr>                                                          ##  1 iNETgrate      Software:AssayDomain:Technology:Sequencing:BiologicalQuestion… ##  2 eisaR          Software:AssayDomain:BiologicalQuestion:ResearchField:Statist… ##  3 HiCBricks      Software:Infrastructure:Technology:Sequencing:DataImport:HiC   ##  4 coGPS          Software:Technology:BiologicalQuestion:Microarray:Differentia… ##  5 TRONCO         Software:ResearchField:StatisticalMethod:BiologicalQuestion:W… ##  6 Rarr           Software:Infrastructure:DataImport                             ##  7 M3Drop         Software:Technology:Sequencing:ResearchField:AssayDomain:Biol… ##  8 CATALYST       Software:StatisticalMethod:Infrastructure:BiologicalQuestion:… ##  9 CancerInSilico Software:ResearchField:AssayDomain:Technology:Sequencing:Immu… ## 10 SynExtend      Software:ResearchField:StatisticalMethod:Infrastructure:Genet…

title: biocEDAM: ontology for a genomic data science ecosystem
text: edamontology.org, EDAM described “comprehensive ontology well-established, familiar concepts prevalent within bioscientific data analysis data management (including computational biology, bioinformatics, bioimage informatics). EDAM includes topics, operations, types data data identifiers, data formats, relevant data analysis data management life sciences.” devel version ontoProc, ingest sample EDAM ontology: main organizing categories EDAM “data”, “format”, “operation” “topic”.
code: library(ontoProc) epath = owl2cache(url="https://edamontology.org/EDAM_1.25.owl") edam = setup_entities(epath) set.seed(1234) sample(labels(edam), 15) ##                                               topic_3370  ##                                   "Analytical chemistry"  ##                                               topic_2258  ##                                        "Cheminformatics"  ##                                               topic_0618  ##                                                 "Scents"  ##                                                data_2190  ##                                      "Sequence checksum"  ##                                                data_1446  ##                           "Comparison matrix (integers)"  ##                                               topic_3301  ##                                           "Microbiology"  ##                                           operation_1822  ## "Protein residue surface calculation (vacuum molecular)"  ##                                                data_2028  ##                                      "Experimental data"  ##                                                data_1141  ##                                             "TIGRFam ID"  ##                                           operation_3457  ##                               "Single particle analysis"  ##                                              format_3816  ##                                                   "Mol2"  ##                                               topic_0624  ##                                            "Chromosomes"  ##                                           operation_2461  ##                    "Protein residue surface calculation"  ##                                              format_2076  ##                         "RNA secondary structure format"  ##                                           operation_0298  ##                              "Profile-profile alignment"

title: biocEDAM: ontology for a genomic data science ecosystem
text: Pypi package text2term used measure similarity terms available EDAM terms biocViews. biocEDAM package includes table results, filter scores exceeding 0.8. Similar programming can used examine biocViews terms low maximum scores matched EDAM. indicate vocabulary gaps filled EDAM, suggest alternative tagging methodology. example, biocViews includes “ExomeSeq”. achieved scores .70, .50, .39 EDAM terms Exome sequencing, Exome assembly, “geneseq” respectively. 9 software packages Bioconductor 3.18 annotated ExomeSeq. Dissection contents additional views terms helpful understanding process needed bridge EDAM Bioconductor improved discoverability packages data.
code: library(biocEDAM) data(allmap) ndf = allmap |> filter(`Mapping Score`>.8) |> select(`Source Term`,                `Mapped Term Label`, `Mapping Score`) |> as.data.frame() library(DT) datatable(ndf)

title: Curation of Bioconductor package metadata, targeting EDAM ontology and ELIXIR bio.tools metadata schemas
text: curation step uses OpenAI API key. curated view chromVAR landing page bioconductor.org : README chromVAR github repo provides additional metadata. can “merged” richer metadata artifact.
code: library(biocEDAM) library(listviewer) library(reticulate) docv = curate_bioc() ## Success after 0 attempts ## Success after 0 attempts jsonedit(py_to_r(docv[[1]])) jsonedit(py_to_r(docv[[2]]))

title: Curation of Bioconductor package metadata, targeting EDAM ontology and ELIXIR bio.tools metadata schemas
code: dotx = curate_bioc(  "tximport",   devurl = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/thelovelab/tximport/refs/heads/devel/vignettes/tximport.Rmd") ## Success after 0 attempts ## Success after 0 attempts full = c(py_to_r(dotx[[1]]), py_to_r(dotx[[2]])) jsonedit(full)
library(listviewer)  jsonedit(   list(     array = c(1,2,3)     ,boolean = TRUE     ,null = NULL     ,number = 123     ,object = list( a="b", c="d" )     ,string = "Hello World"   ) )
